name: Avoid Select * queries in PHP Section (PHP)
description: This rule searches all the PHP Sections having "SELECT * FROM …" clause.
output:
The report lists all PHP Sections  having "SELECT * FROM " clause.

This QR provides following information:
- PHP Section full name
rationale:
A query that retrieves all columns of a table with a SELECT * can potentially be
the source of performance problems:

Such performance problems may arise
when the execution of the query returns a large result sets (many row with all the columns may then become
a huge amount of data to transport over the network).
Thus optimzer module can't provide a
correct execution.

Also, when using such queries, one cannot control how the columns
will be ordered and returned to the client. This can lead to important data inconsistencies and thus
stability issues.
remediation: Limit the columns in your SQL select statements to those applications really needing it.
